intro: Stachytarpheta monachinoi, commonly known as the sacred basil or holy basil, is a shrub native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
